item.title: Graffiti and flyposting on section of wall opposite Bus stop at 312 Brixton road SW9, 24th November
item.description:
I like to report graffiti and flyposting at 312 - 308 Brixton road SW9. The graffiti and flyposting is on a wall across the road from a bus stop. The wall itself is in a reddish terracotta colour its not joined to any particular building. Both the graffiti and flyposting have been up for over two weeks. Please can they be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brixton Road, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole outside Waitrose by the zebra crossing, 24th November
item.description:
Large pothole just outside Waitrose next to the zebra crossing. I drove over it on Saturday night without seeing it as dark. I will be very surprised if there isnâ€™t damage to my cars tyres, wheel and/or suspension as it made an almighty bang. I will be having the car inspected and will follow up with a claim against Bexley Council if there is found to be any damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household crap dumped in street in Brett Close, 24th November
item.description:
Household crap (ironing board, clothes, some crappy furniture) dumped in street in Brett Close. Happens every week. No action ever taken against resident fly tipping.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brett Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zebra crossing light out, 24th November
item.description:
Ever since moving here I never realised the pole in between the crossing was supposed to be a zebra crossing light until I looked up the other night and noticed the white stripes and the lamp that resembled the zebra crossing lights, however the light has never turned on before and as well as this the drivers give no way what so ever so you're always stuck there waiting for ages before you are able to cross which is really inconvenient considering the lamp is right outside of my uni campus.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45-65, Peckham Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: . 3 safety barriers fallen over outside 209 Crofton lane, 24th November
item.description:
. 3 large safety barriwes were placed around a damaged bollard . These have now all fallen over and are completely blocking the pavement and part of the road. This has been like this for several weeks and is a hazard to pedestrians.and cars. Those with pushchairs and wheelchairs can not get round the heap of barriers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
